Authors:
De-Ping Wei, Dhanushka Nadeeshan Wanasinghe, Yuan-Pin Xiao,
To-anun Chaiwat, Kevin D Hyde
Title: The genus Simplicillium
Abstract:
Simplicillium species have wide host range and extensive
distribution. Some of which have associated with rust fungi and plant
pathogenic fungi and play an important role in biological control. In
this current work, two specimens were collected from Chiang Mai,
Thailand. We introduce Simplicillium formicae isolated from an infected
ant as a new species and Simplicillium lanosoniveum occurring on
Ophiocordycep unilateralis as a new host record species based on
morphological study and phylogenies from analyses of a multigene dataset
(combined nrLSU, nrSSU, tef-1a and rpb1 sequences) as well as an
individual ITS gene sequences data. Morphologically, Simplicillium
formicae significantly differ from other species in producing
flask-shaped synnemata and special phialides with intercalary node. The
new record species resemble to other strain of Simplicillium
lanosoniveum in completely solitary, tapering phialides, globose to
ellipsoidal conidia which adhering in slimly head. The host of the new
record species similar to Ophiocordycep unilateralis in single stromata
which emerging from ant host and lateral, hemispherical ascomatal
cushion as well as flask-shaped perithecia. The key to species of
Simplicillium was provided to understand the interspecies
relationships.
